title: Should I move to South Korea, Seoul, or Japan? - Quora
tags: Visiting and Travel in South Korea

response.answer_text: Depends on your background goals and talents. Both have high cost of living and a good part of the populations that are not fully accepting to all foreigners, so you should consider other countries. I moved to SK in 1997 because I was an officer in the US ARMY then in 2000 staying here because of my sudden transition to working a hagwon ESL job and SK seem to have the easiest to get decent ESL positions and for strong health safety/security low cost health insurance and management of health care challenges like corona. I actually prefer to live in another country like Philippines Malaysia or USA for the lifestyle more comfort and much lower cost of living, but work is number 1 for me. FOLLOW THE WORK~

It’s simple, there are some big general categories. Japan- more courteous and polite, better manners. Quiet, reserved, and you’ll be left alone. Awesome foods but the way you eat is different, you’ll be alone many times. More cash based and no English.  Korea- friendlier, louder and making friends to wine and dine with is likely. Food is awesome and spicy, we love Viking style get togethers. We use tech w money and have English everywhere. There are a lot of similarities….move to the better job and money.
